intro: Pleurospermum obtusiusculum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pleurospermum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and feathery leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
